address: Xã Quảng Lộc, Huyện Quảng Xương, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa
thought:
**Navigating the Administrative Labyrinth of Thanh Hóa**

Okay, so I've got "Xã Quảng Lộc, Huyện Quảng Xương, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" to sort out. My goal is to figure out the new administrative unit for this address. First things first, I note the province: Thanh Hóa. That's my starting point.

I start by checking the province-level resolutions (specifically 60-NQ/TW). Good news, Thanh Hóa isn't merging at the provincial level. So, on to the finer details. I'm focusing on resolution 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, the one dealing with administrative restructuring in Thanh Hóa.

Immediately, I see a potential hiccup. Line 11 of 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15 mentions "Quang Lộc", which is *close* to the target, "Quảng Lộc". However, I've got to be meticulous. These are distinct names in Vietnamese administrative contexts. While "Quang Lộc" is mentioned in the resolution, the input address specifies "Quảng Lộc". So, this line doesn't apply *directly*. It does make me extra-cautious though, so I keep my eyes peeled.

Then I get a crucial breakthrough. Line 31 of that same resolution *explicitly* lists "Quảng Lộc" alongside other wards that are merging into "xã Quảng Bình". Bingo! That's a direct hit. I've got a match. The old "Xã Quảng Lộc" is now part of the new "Xã Quảng Bình".

To confirm my findings, I check the new wards data. I see entries for both "Xã Hoa Lộc" (from the "Quang Lộc" situation from Line 11) and "Xã Quảng Bình" – confirming that the resolution and data align.

Ultimately, based on the direct mention in resolution 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15, line 31, I'm confident in concluding that the new administrative unit for "Xã Quảng Lộc, Huyện Quảng Xương, Tỉnh Thanh Hóa" is "Xã Quảng Bình". That's the correct new ward!

citation.header: 1686/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Thanh Hóa
citation.line: 31. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Quảng Lưu, Quảng Lộc, Quảng Thái và Quảng Bình thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Quảng Bình.
